# Government Tender: Video Surveillance System Replacement

## Notice Information

* **Requisition Number**: WS4361537197-Doc4361568094
* **Amendment Number**: 3
* **Publication Date**: December 19, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: January 30, 2024 - 02:00:00 PM EST
* **Amendment Date**: January 23, 2024

## Project Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO), is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the replacement of the video surveillance system in our facilities in Quebec, Canada.

The project aims to deploy a new network of video surveillance cameras, install new conduits and cabling (optical fiber), and construct a server room (recording room) with armored partition. Modifications to ventilation, electricity, lighting, fire detection and alarm systems, and sprinkler networks will also be carried out. The existing video surveillance system infrastructure will be partially dismantled.

## Selection Criteria

The selection criteria for this RFP are:

* **Lowest Price**

## Trade Agreements

* **Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)**

## Contact Information

* **Contracting Agency**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contact Person**: Jennifer Kirouac (SPAC/PSPC)
* **Email**: [jennifer.kirouac@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:jennifer.kirouac@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

## Tender Description

The successful bidder will be responsible for:

* Deploying a new network of video surveillance cameras
* Installing new conduits and cabling (optical fiber)
* Constructing a server room (recording room) with armored partition
* Modifying ventilation, electricity, lighting, fire detection and alarm systems, and sprinkler networks
* Partially dismantling the existing video surveillance system infrastructure

For more information, please refer to the RFP document at
https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18322663?extsite=MTgzMjI2NjNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==.
